news_header: A passenger plane with 64 people crashed into the Potomac River after colliding with a US Army helicopter. At least 19 bodies have been recovered.
news_text: A passenger plane carrying 64 people crashed into the Potomac River after colliding with a US Army helicopter near Washington DC. Search and rescue teams are working in freezing conditions, and at least 19 bodies have been recovered. The plane was a Bombardier CRJ700 operated by PSA Airlines as American Airlines 5342, and it was returning from a development camp in Kansas. The helicopter involved was a Sikorsky H-60 on a training flight with three soldiers on board. The FAA and NTSB are investigating the incident.
